titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3) to combat violent youth crime and increase accountability for juvenile criminal offenses.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-89, by Mr. Solomon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 29.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 159 (Roll no. 109).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/6/1997--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3 (juvenile crime).
